{"step_by_step_thinking": "Histamine is a compound that is involved in local immune responses and acts as a neurotransmitter. It is produced by basophils and mast cells found in nearby connective tissues. Mast cells are especially numerous at sites of potential injury and are a major source of histamine. Therefore, histamine is present on the surface of mast cells.", "answer_choice": "B. Mast cells"}
